As an AI language model, I do not have access to real-time statistics. However, here are some numbers as of August 2020:

- At least 89,000 healthcare workers in New York State have contracted COVID-19, including 27 who have died.
- In New York City alone, over 1,300 healthcare workers have been hospitalized due to COVID-19.
- Despite accounting for only 10% of the state's workforce, healthcare workers represented 18% of COVID-19 cases in New York as of July 2020.

Governor Andrew Cuomo has taken several measures to protect healthcare workers during the pandemic, including:

- Requiring hospitals to stockpile at least a 90-day supply of personal protective equipment (PPE), such as masks and gowns.
- Ensuring that healthcare workers have the necessary PPE and training to safely treat COVID-19 patients.
- Mandating that hospitals increase their capacity to handle a surge of COVID-19 patients and to transfer patients as needed to prevent overcrowding.
- Creating a task force to investigate and respond to reports of healthcare facility violations related to COVID-19.
- Offering mental health resources and support to healthcare workers who may be experiencing stress, trauma, or burnout due to the pandemic.
